title: Agbe
author: Agbe
created_time: May 30, 2022, 08:30:53 PMLast edit: June 30, 2022, 12:56:23 PM by Agbe
content: Bitcointalk 2022 Registered Users by MonthlyThis is a list of some of the registered users in Bitcointalk 2022, though some are banned. If your name is not here or someone you know who registered this year and the user is not here, please drop it in the comment box.Follow this format.Code:url= profile link here]username here[/url]Data were collected from beginners & help and from page 1 to page 18. Although some users used other boards but I used beginners & help as inductive data collection.  I will update it every monthJanuary:  3rek0s3  Z-tight  coinmanhere  Oluwa-btc  DVlog  Bitcoinbride comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: The monthly registered users is not important information or statistics, stats that are worth posting are stats that users are curious to know about. I don't know if your stats are accurate though, but nobody woud be concerned about this.Quote from: Agbe on May 30, 2022, 08:30:53 PMData were collected from beginners & help and from page 1 to page 18. Although some users used other boards but I used beginners & help as inductive data collection.  Only beginners & help? That means your data is incorrect on arrival, what about users that registered and haven't made any post at all on the forum, what about users that registered and didn't make any post in beginners & help.

comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on May 30, 2022, 08:30:53 PMThis is a list of some of the registered users in Bitcointalk 2022, though some are banned. /cut/Is this the list of registered users or the list of users who posted in the Beginners & Help subforum? I don't understand the purpose of compiling a list of users in this way. You can easily use the list of all registered users compiled and updated daily by LoyceV: LoyceV's complete List of all Bitcointalk usernames

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on May 30, 2022, 08:30:53 PMI will update it every monthSorry to say this, I know you put in a lot of effort to compile the list, but you are wasting your effort on something that's not so important. First, most of the accounts created here are just bots that either get nuke after spamming or trying to spread malware, or just remain brand new without posting anything. How are you going to track such accounts?

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on May 30, 2022, 11:31:29 PMQuote from: Agbe on May 30, 2022, 08:30:53 PMI will update it every monthSorry to say this, I know you put in a lot of effort to compile the list, but you are wasting your effort on something that's not so important. First, most of the accounts created here are just bots that either get nuke after spamming or trying to spread malware, or just remain brand new without posting anything. How are you going to track such accounts?Yes I understand you, but I am trying to know those who enter the forum and post, mostly in the beginners & help Board in each month regardless of their ambition. And I believe it will help users for future usage and for statistic analysis.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: I appreciated your effort but I don't get your idea behind this topic. After looking at your information format for each month, I am more confusing about what you want to do.There are some topics about monthly statsAssumed monthly statistics on registered accounts of bitcointalk.org (2009-2019)Time Series on monthly statistics of forum (new users, new topics, new posts)Statistics Bitcointalk.org

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: You are doing this manually? Thats totally dope dude. However I find it not useful when it comes to data statistics. Quote from: Agbe on May 30, 2022, 11:44:25 PMYes I understand you, but I am trying to know those who enter the forum and post, mostly in the beginners & help Board in each month regardless of their ambition. And I believe it will help users for future usage and for statistic analysis.Im not sure though since you are collecting names and possiblt most of them are newly created account created for spam attack. The data presentation could be improved without hyperlinking the account name but only uses a straight row, much easier to notice.But what is your goal aside from to view who are entered the forum?

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on May 30, 2022, 08:30:53 PM<...>I’m not sure it’s going to be worth trying to compile all those account names, going through 18 pages of threads, and then paging within each of these threads, to determine the names of those accounts created within a given month. It seems like a pretty time consuming manual task.In any case, If I were to be inclined to do so, I’d probably try to use ninjastic as an accelerator. It doesn't have all you’d need, but it should save a lot of time. For example, the following query lists 455 profile names that have posted in B&H this month to date. From there on, you’d need to enter each profile and check its "Date Registered" value of the user’s profile (*):https://ninjastic.space/search?after_date=2022-05-01T11%3A07%3A17&before_date=2022-05-31T11%3A07%3A17&board=39 (go to user's tab and press "Generate")(*) Ideally, you’d be able to cross the above 455 names with another source to automate deriving the "Date Registered" dates. I don’t recall their being an already existing and updated file generated by anyone with this information, so with time, you could eventually adventure into scraping the said profiles …

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: I won't be original in saying that I understand that you were trying to do something useful, but you wasted your time.No offense mate, it's not interesting.But, I thought for a moment that you were interested in the paths of newcomers who have come recently. Here we can say that a newcomer who stays on the forum for a long time becomes noticeable after a while. You are the most direct example. I see and read you quite often.But those who just signed up and wrote one or two posts... do they really deserve attention? Why do you need them?Just spare your time.

comments.author: Shamm
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on May 30, 2022, 08:30:53 PM<......>Hello Op, good day and good job I appreciate your effort but this information or list is not useful at all you know why? Because no one except you is interested to know how many users will be registered from the beginning of the year 2022. I think the right op that you list is not enough and also what you gathered are that users who are already posted  in the beginners and help section.And remember Op that there are many threads out there and for sure many newbies posted there.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: 1. Not all new registered users will always make a post in Beginner and Help section. 2. Alright now I know @3rek0s3 is the first user created on 2022 and @MetaHusk is the last user created on May 2022, what's next? it's really something we need to know every accounts created in this forum? 3. I will wait the update of the next 6 months, if not you're a liar.Quote from: Agbe on May 30, 2022, 08:30:53 PMI will update it every month

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: For a moment I thought my screen broke, the lines you drew almost gave me an heart attack   Now on a serious note, I can tell you put a lot of effort into this long post, collecting this data manually wouldn’t have been easy. Did you try using Ninjastic bot or LoyceV bot to see if they already have the data you’re looking for or a feature that can make your search easier. To conclude your research, you didn’t signify the purpose of the thread, your deductions and observations of the new members, that would be something I hope you update. Well done!

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Quote from: Jawhead999 on June 01, 2022, 02:10:08 PM2. Alright now I know @3rek0s3 is the first user created on 2022 and @MetaHusk is the last user created on May 2022, what's next? it's really something we need to know every accounts created in this forum? 3. I will wait the update of the next 6 months, if not you're a liar.I am not lier. I collected the data in randomly. I didn't follow first come and first serve. Any user that I saw at the time of collecting the data, I used it. Please cross check the months again.Quote from: SatoPrincess on June 01, 2022, 04:59:28 PM...you didn’t signify the purpose of the thread, your deductions and observations of the new members, that would be something I hope you update. Well done!For information purpose. So users can easily find other users here. I am also writing a project in University on Bitcoin so the demographic analysis needs the population of bitcoin users in this year. Abd I also thank those who sent Ninjastic bot and LoyceV bot to me through this thread.

comments.author: kaggie
comments.body: There have been ~50,000 users who registered on this forum during 2022, so about 10k / month.So, I think you may be falling a little short here with your numbers.However, what is interesting is discerning what the new users are after. For example, what percentage of new users who are asking about their ancient unproven bitcoin who have < 5 posts? How many claim to be Satoshi? How many ask questions that actually appear legitimate (and not fishing for information to scam users)? How many move onto having signature campaigns?There are interesting questions here if you are willing to look for them, and perhaps you are doing so but it is not evident yet. If you ask questions on this forum, I'm certain experienced users may have be able to recommend additional tools. Good luck

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on June 01, 2022, 06:15:41 PMQuote from: SatoPrincess on June 01, 2022, 04:59:28 PM...you didn’t signify the purpose of the thread, your deductions and observations of the new members, that would be something I hope you update. Well done!For information purpose. So users can easily find other users here. I am also writing a project in University on Bitcoin so the demographic analysis needs the population of bitcoin users in this year. Abd I also thank those who sent Ninjastic bot and LoyceV bot to me through this thread. If you are doing a research on the number of bitcoin users in 2022, then you shouldn’t even be using this method for data collection. The research topic is too broad imo, you should be more specific and limit your research to a city or country. Your data will not be accurate if you only use the number of newly registered users in bitcointalk. The accounts you recorded may be bots, alts of old members, bounty hunters, spammers, e.t.c these categories are not new bitcoin users (remember bounty hunters concern themselves with mostly altcoins section of the forum) and their reasons for being here may not be genuine. You will need to collect data from other websites that have done similar research and so on.

comments.author: isaac_clarke22
comments.body: Quote from: SatoPrincess on June 01, 2022, 07:55:14 PMIf you are doing a research on the number of bitcoin users in 2022, then you shouldn’t even be using this method for data collection. The research topic is too broad imo, you should be more specific and limit your research to a city or country. Your data will not be accurate if you only use the number of newly registered users in bitcointalk. The accounts you recorded may be bots, alts of old members, bounty hunters, spammers, e.t.c these categories are not new bitcoin users (remember bounty hunters concern themselves with mostly altcoins section of the forum) and their reasons for being here may not be genuine. You will need to collect data from other websites that have done similar research and so on. I am pretty sure that not all users of Bitcoin are even registered here in Bitcointalk. They could be just reading around here as a Guest but do not really want to participate.If OP is aiming to conduct such analysis, it would be a better to specify a specific area (e.g his/her local area) just like what you said.

comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on June 01, 2022, 06:15:41 PMI am not lier. I collected the data in randomly. I didn't follow first come and first serve. Any user that I saw at the time of collecting the data, I used it. Please cross check the months again.Lol it's more worse since you collected the data randomly, if you have worked on big data or data science major, you would get kicked for doing that since you're messing the data. I mean, I will wait the next month about your update since you said you will update the new registered users every month and I will wait for the update for 6 months consecutive, you're the one who promise to update it every month, not me.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Quote from: kaggie on June 01, 2022, 07:24:23 PMThere have been ~50,000 users who registered on this forum during 2022, so about 10k / month.Thanks you very much, but where is the source of your information? Because if I used that figure without source  it will affect my analysis

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on June 02, 2022, 03:09:32 AM<...>The official forum stats  that counted the number of new users per month (amongst other things) stopped being updated halfway through December 2017. Some people kept track for a while longer, but I don’t recall anyone tracing  the numbers currently. In any case, in order to do it yourself, you’d need to play around with the User IDs on the profile URLs to find the Ids that correspond to the first and last users created on a given month (i.e. April 22 (*): https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3462332 .. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3472054). Trial and error. It took 2 minutes for me to find the prior Ids for accounts created during April 22.Nevertheless:-   The number of Bitcointalk created accounts per se is not really that representative of too much: many seem to be bot created and stay forever with 0 posts (more than those accounts that do post). -   You were targeting those created and participating in B&H, so having the total global amount isn’t really the goal on this thread (unless you want to contrast the ratio between the two sets).Quote from: Agbe on June 01, 2022, 06:15:41 PM<…> I am also writing a project in University on Bitcoin so the demographic analysis needs the population of bitcoin users in this year. <…>That’s quite a chimera. Obviously you’d be using sources outside the scope of the forum itself. I’ve seen various attempts here and there to estimate the population of bitcoin (not Bitcointalk) users per year, and logically they all resort to a wide range of hypothesis to try to estimate the figure one way or another.(*) Exact IDs for the begining and end of a given month may vary in different timezones.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on May 30, 2022, 08:30:53 PMData were collected from beginners & help and from page 1 to page 18Even though i appreciate your efforts in putting this little up together but i will ad well like to advise you in this manner, whenever there is a need for the collection of data in this regards then it should be properly done, this will bring out the beauty in it, if you take a look at @loyceV thread on  The future of Bitcointalk: Low Ranking Top Merit earners in the past 30 days the data were accurate and updated, this could not just be done anyhow but the beauty is in the organization and quality efforts put together in creating it, i will as well advise if OP can get to develop himself more in learning how to extract data with the help of the experience users on the forum so as to do more better on this aspect in the nearest future.
